questions.correct_answer: B. Residual from barrel of gun
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Residual from barrel of gun As Bullet passes through the barrel , the dirt & grease substance (used for barrel lubrication), gets smeared on the bullet surface. So this bullet, now carrying the dirt and grease, as it enters the body, wipes itself off (so called bullet wipe ) .

Highyeild:

Bullet wipe- Bullet wipe is also called Grease collar or Dirt collar. A "bullet wipe" is a dark ring around the perimeter of the entrance in a target. The ring is formed by and contains bullet lubricant , by-products of propellant , traces of bullet metal , and residue in the gun barrel from previous use. As Bullet passes through the barrel, the dirt & grease substance (used for barrel lubrication), gets smeared on the bullet So this bullet, now carrying the dirt and grease , as it enters the body, wipes itself off (so called bullet wipe) the dirt and grease from its surface, onto the skin around the entry wound . This creates a ring of dirt or grease around the entry wound , called Grease / Dirt collar. Around the wound of entry, first is Grease collar & surrounding it will be abrasion collar.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Blackening - The deposition of smoke / soot around the entry wound is called Blackening / smudging / soiling. It can be easily wiped off with a wet sponge. Option C. Gutter fracture of skull -Long and Narrow fracture Seen with bullet glance / graze /slap of skull. Option D. Tattooing -Partly burnt/unburnt gun powder particles.Around entry wound, they are adherent to the skin. It cannot be wiped away and felt as This is called tattooing / stippling / peppering.

questions.text: Identify the plant which produces a deliriant toxin:-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Erythroxylon Coca The plant shown is Erythroxylon Coca , from which Cocaine is produced.

Highyeild:

COCAINE - Obtained from leaves of Erythroxylon Coca. Slang names : White lady, Coke, Cadillac, Snow Cigarettes with cocaine called crack Cocaine leaves contain < 2% of cocaine→ Treated with H2SO4 → Cocaine sulfate → Treated with HCl→ Cocaine Hydrochloride →Cocaine hydrochloride contains 90% of cocaine →Used for snorting and injections Cocaine hydrochloride again treated with baking soda → crack → smoke Most Common usage – snorting Actions Local Anesthetic Powerful CNS depressant – for a short time Rush followed by depression. Signs and symptoms Acute addiction: Stage of early stimulation- euphoria, dry mouth,tachycardia,numb mouth. Stage of advanced stimulation- hallucination, hyperthermia (cocaine fever), convulsions. Stage of depression- Muscle paralysis, coma, death. Treatment : Amyl Nitrate Chronic Addiction- Cocainism Cocainophagia Cocainomana Black discoloration of teeth & tongue Painless perforation of Nasal septum Magnum symptoms – also called cocaine bugs /formication/Tactile Hallucination → Bugs / Insects / Sand particles crawling beneath skin→ Scratching → Multiple scratch marks + →Bruxism → Grinding of teeth. Medico Legal Importance- Cocaine – 2nd most commonly used illicit drug. Applied on glans penis to increase duration of coitus. Prostitutes inject into vagina for local construction Cocaine + Heroine → I.V – speedball → smoke – moon rock

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Hyoscine - is an active principle in Dhatura , A Neurotoxic Deliriant poison. Option B.Cannabis-Cannabis sativa or Indica is a neurotoxic cerebral deliriant poison. Option C.Datura- All parts of the plant are poisonous, particularly fruits and seeds.

questions.text: Which of the following are correctly matched?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Rokitansky - in situ Is the only correctly matched autopsy technique.

Highyeild:

Types of Autopsy techniques: Method Dissection Note Virchow’s method organs are removed one by one M/C used technique (convenient and easy) Rokitansky method In-situ dissection The contact between tissue fluids of the body and autopsy surgeon is minimal, because the body may spread some infection (dreaded infection). e.g., HIV, Covid Preferred method to conduct autopsy in newborn or fetal autopsy. Ghon’s method En-block/ Block Dissection Head and neck as one block, Thorax as one block , Abdomen and pelvis as one block. Lettules method En masse dissection Here entire structures of the neck, chest, abdomen including the pelvis are removed as a single mass. It is the best autopsy technique

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B and D are incorrect.

Extraedge:

Opening of cavities of body: No hard fast rule to open which cavity first. The body cavity affected the most to be opened first. It has some exceptions In a case of head injury - The cranial cavity shall not be opened first, First thorax is opened, heart removed and blood is drained In case of mechanical asphyxia (compression of neck)- Neck is not opened first, but opened last since we have to study neck structures thoroughly & we need bloodless field / dissection of the neck. ➔ As a second school of thought head has to be opened first as a rule of thumb. Conditions where the skull is opened first: Suspected case of air embolism – to find the presence of air bubbles in meningeal vessels . In case of suspected poisoned cases with peculiar odour like Cyanide – bitter almond smell Carbolic acid – phenolic smell Organophosphorus – Kerosene smell.

questions.text: The postmortem change seen in the Image below corresponds to which of the following:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Marbling Image shows an irregular tortuous network of discolored veins . Reddish brown / greenish discolored veins Look like branches of a tree / marbled appearance . These are seen in the roots of limbs,abdomen and flanks . It is well established by 36 to 48 hours.

Highyeild:

Decomposition/putrefaction: Colour changes: The earliest sign of decomposition is greenish discoloration of the body, seen first in the right iliac fossa externally and under the liver internally ( because in caecum , the contents are more liquid and are full of bacteria.) . In these areas, It appears in 12-18 hours, and slowly spread on whole body in 24-48 hr. greenish discoloration is due to formation of Sulph meth haemoglobin. Hb→ meth Hb→ +H2S→ Sulph meth haemoglobin. Later colour may change to purple, brown, bluish green or even almost black ( colour black is due to ferric sulphide.) The colouring matter (Hb) dissociates from the B.C. and the colour is taken up by the blood vessels, which are seen as prominent lines having purple, green or brown colour, especially on shoulders, axilla & Inguinal area. This change results in 24-48 hr , and is labelled as marbling.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Rigor mortis- State of Stiffening of muscles with very little shortening of muscle fibers .Single most important reason is depletion of ATP. Option C.Algor mortis -Cooling of body after death . because, Metabolisms of body stopped, no energy is produced, hence body cools. Option D.Post mortem lividity -It is purplish blue or purplish red discoloration seen under the skin in the most superficial layers of dermis, on dependent parts of the body after death due to capillo-venous distension.

questions.text: Match the following snakes with their names (Column – A with Column – B):- Select the correct answer using the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a = 4 / b = 1 / c = 3 / d = 2

Highyeild:

The four venomous snake species responsible for causing the greatest number of medically significant human snake bite cases in India are: Common krait-Bungarus caeruleus Russell's viper- Daboia russelli Indian saw-scaled viper-Echis carinatus Indian cobra- Naja naja Identification of snakes -

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B,D are not the correct match.

Table:

#MANTRA Treatment of snake bite- Counselling the patient and family- Reassuring them that not all snakes are poisonous. Prevention of spread of venom- clean the bite area, Immobilise the patient Use of antivenom therapy- In India polyvalent ASV is only available It is effective against all the four common species; Russells viper (Daboia russelli), Common Cobra (raja naja) Common Krait (Bungarus caeruleus) Saw Scaled viper (Echis carinatus). ASV is the mainstay of treatment. It is lypohilised e. freeze dried and reconstituted . Sensitivity testing should be done by injecting 1 ml intradermally. Given within 4hr of bite. Treatment of absorbed venom- Neurotoxic envenomation: ‘Atropine Neostigmine (AN) ’effective for postsynaptic neurotoxins such as those of the Krait affects presynaptic fibres where calcium ions act as neurotransmitters. Give Calcium gluconate and continue till neuroparalysis recovers which may last for 5-7 days. Viper bite -Give heparin and fibrinogen . Symptomatic and general treatment- TT,antihistamines,analgesic, artificial respiration, hemodialysis.

questions.text: An 11 Year old girl was found to be quiet and shy in her classroom with intermittent crying, for the past few days. It was discovered that her uncle was touching her genitals inappropriately. What is the duty of the principal to report this to?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inform police This case comes under the POCSO act 2012 (protection of children from sexual offences). And the case should be directly and compulsorily reported to police.

Highyeild:

POCSO act 2012 (Protection Of Children from Sexual Offences) Amended in 2019- It is a gender neutral law. Children- MALE/FEMALE<18 year. Not reporting abuse is an offence (sec 19,21). No time limit for reporting abuse. Maintaining confidentiality of the victim’s identity. (sec.23) The police officer while recording the statement of the child shall not be in Woman police officer not below the rank of sub-inspector. Special court: Additional district court. Trial should be completed in 1 year. In camera trial. The child shall not see accused in any proceedings. Sections 3,5,7,9,11,13-definitions. Sections 4,6,8,10,12,14- punishment. Classes of offence under POCSO act- Classes of offence under POCSO act- Class of offence Includes Punishable under section Punishment Penetrative sexual assault Penetration/ Insertion/ Manipulation/application into mouth/vagina/anus. section 4 10 year to life imprisonment Aggravated Penetrative sexual assault Penetrative sexual assault with Mentally ill child. OR someone in position of trust/authority OR Aggravated Penetrative sexual assault Child become pregnant OR gang rape OR Multiple time sexual assault section 6 20 year to life imprisonment ORChild gets HIV. Sexual assault Physical contact with Sexual intent but NO Penetration/ Insertion/ Manipulation/application Section 8 3 to 5 year imprisonment. Aggravated sexual assault Sexual assault with Mentally ill child. OR someone in position of DBM trust/authority Aggravated sexual assault Estd. OR Child become pregnant OR gang rape OR Multiple time sexual assault ORChild gets HIV. Section 10 5 to 7 year imprisonment. Sexual harassment Sexual intent is present.Showing pornography/eve teasing/child body part exhibition /threatening by media Section 12 Imprisonment upto 3 year with fine Child pornography is banned section 14 3 to 7 year imprisonment.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,C,D are incorrect . Because any child sexual abuse case should be directly and compulsorily reported to police under POCSO act.
